voyage_to_stormwreck_isle.title: Voyage to Stormwreck Isle
voyage_to_stormwreck_isle.read_aloud: Your journey has been smooth sailing so far. You left the bustling port of Neverwinter a few days ago, heading for an island with the foreboding name of Stormwreck Isle. But you woke this morning to a blood-red sunrise, and dark clouds overhead threaten a violent storm.
voyage_to_stormwreck_isle.gm_guidance: Introduce the adventure and set the scene. The players are on a ship heading to Stormwreck Isle. The environment is tense with a storm brewing.

edges.label: As lightning flashes across the sky, a monster hauls itself up onto the deck!

merrow_encounter.title: Merrow Encounter
merrow_encounter.read_aloud: As lightning flashes across the sky, a monster hauls itself up onto the deck! 'These waters belong to the Scaled Queen. I’m here to collect her tribute.'
merrow_encounter.gm_guidance: The merrow demands tribute for the Scaled Queen. Players can negotiate, attack, or use creative solutions. If negotiating, each DC 15 Charisma check reduces the tribute by 100 gp. The merrow is not overly threatening and can be defeated in 1-2 rounds.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The merrow makes two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

edges.label: With a splash, the merrow disappears into the ocean deeps and the ship continues on its way.

arrival_at_dragons_rest.title: Arrival at Dragon's Rest
arrival_at_dragons_rest.read_aloud: Stormwreck Isle—now visible off the bow—promises rare wonders. Seaweed shimmers in countless brilliant colors below you, and rays of sunlight defy the overcast sky to illuminate the lush grass and dark basalt rock of the island.
arrival_at_dragons_rest.gm_guidance: The ship arrives at Dragon's Rest. Players can introduce their characters and discuss their reasons for visiting. Encourage them to establish a marching order.

edges.label: As you’re about to leave the beach and start your climb, you hear a ruckus of splashing and a wet, gurgling moan behind you.

drowned_sailors_encounter.title: Drowned Sailors Encounter
drowned_sailors_encounter.read_aloud: As you’re about to leave the beach and start your climb, you hear a ruckus of splashing and a wet, gurgling moan behind you. Three figures are shambling up from the water’s edge, about thirty feet away.
drowned_sailors_encounter.gm_guidance: Three zombie sailors approach. Players can fight or flee. Zombies have Undead Fortitude, making them hard to kill. Radiant damage bypasses this. If players are defeated, Elder Runara rescues them.

stats.name: Zombie
stats.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it makes a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.description: The zombie doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

interactions.success: Recall that radiant damage or critical hits can finish off a zombie

edges.label: If players defeat or avoid the zombies, they continue to Dragon's Rest.

dragons_rest_temple.title: Dragon's Rest Temple
dragons_rest_temple.read_aloud: A large, open-air temple comes into view, perched on the edge of a cliff high above you. The ship drops anchor at the mouth of the harbor, and two sailors row you ashore.
dragons_rest_temple.gm_guidance: Players arrive at Dragon's Rest. They can explore, meet Elder Runara, and learn about the island's dangers. Encourage character interaction and exploration.

equipment: Broken blade as a trophy from a fallen enemy
characters.background_story: You trained as a soldier in the island of Mintarn and joined a mercenary company...
